content: Feynman and I tried to work together on a bunch of things over the years. On quantum computers before anyone had ever heard of those. On trying to make a chip that would generate perfect physical randomness — or eventually showing that that wasn’t possible. On whether all the computation needed to evaluate Feynman diagrams really was necessary. On whether it was a coincidence or not that there’s an e^–H t in statistical mechanics and an e^i H t in quantum mechanics. On what the simplest essential phenomenon of quantum mechanics really is.
